sense.def: Alternative Names dai yan 戴眼 , eyes turned upward; diao yan 吊眼 , hauled eyes; yan fan bu xia 眼翻不下 , eyes turned upward without coming down. Illness Sign of eyeballs turned upward, with patients being unable to move them. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 82: Zhi xiao er tai han zhu fang 治小兒胎寒諸方 , All recipes to cure fetal cold: 治小兒五十日以來，胎寒腹痛，微熱而驚，聚唾弄舌，躽啼上視，此癇 之候 , “It cures children who at the age of 50 days [suffer from] fetal cold with abdominal pain, slight heat with fright, accumulation of saliva and non-directional movements of the tongue. The body is bent forward, [the child] weeps and vision is turned upward . These are the signs of epilepsy”.
